metadata.synopsis: Dialog with Oliver, in which the player confronts him and convinces him to rejoin Thaniel, his other half. so that the shadow curse can be lifted. Oliver will always return to Thaniel after this dialogue, but the player can be harsh or gentle in how they do so.
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. Debug Book - Set Quest Flags - Act 2 - GLO Lifting the Curse - Halsin at camp with Spirit2. Debug Book - Set Quest Flags - Act 2 - GLO Lifting the Curse - Oliver fled to Town - this will teleport you to the plaze in the Town3. Approach Oliver, he will start a fight and summon some creatures.4. Teleport closer to him - he'll unsummon the creatures and start this dialog with you.

33.speaker: Oliver
33.text: I'm not leaving - you can't make me!

58.speaker: Halsin
58.text: Be gentle. He's much more than a child, but he doesn't truly know that.
58.context: NodeContext: Discreet, advisory. Doesn't want to upset Oliver any more than he already is.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: You don't have to leave. All you have to do is lend Thaniel your strength.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: You're just a thieving shadow that thinks it's a child. Playtime's over - Thaniel's waiting.

43.speaker: Oliver
43.text: You're a bad winner, but you're still a winner. I'll go - you've taken everything that I cared about.

56.speaker: Halsin
56.text: You didn't need to be so hard on him.
56.context: NodeContext: Disapproving. We said something unnecessarily harsh to Oliver

39.speaker: Oliver
39.text: I hope you're nicer to Thaniel than you are to me.

52.speaker: Halsin
52.text: It's done. More cruelly than it needed to be, but done all the same. We should return to Thaniel when we can.
52.context: NodeContext: Satisfied - but with a tinge of criticism towards the player

18.speaker: Player
18.text: You have what you want, but not what you need: Thaniel. He's your friend, your kin - he's you.

54.speaker: Oliver
54.text: He's nothing to me. He left me here, all this time. I had to do everything for myself!

4.speaker: Oliver
4.text: Even when it was scary. Even when I was alone. I didn't give up.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: Nobody's to blame here. The curse tore you two apart - now you can be reunited.

25.speaker: Oliver
25.text: But would he even want me back...? I've changed. A lot.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Of course he will. You're bound to each other - always.

2.speaker: Oliver
2.text: So I wouldn't have to be alone anymore? He'd stay with me? Play with me?

14.speaker: Oliver
14.text: I'd like that. And he would too, I think. All right, I'll do it. I want to do it.

53.speaker: Halsin
53.context: NodeContext: Proud, choking up a little.

21.speaker: Oliver
21.text: Are you crying? You're a bit big to be crying... but I suppose that's okay.

62.speaker: Oliver
62.text: Bye. And thank you for playing with me.

5.speaker: Halsin
5.text: It's done, at last. Soon the land will be unshrouded. We should return to Thaniel when we can.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Change is good. That's what growing up is all about. Together, you two will become more than you were before.

51.speaker: Oliver
51.text: So I wouldn't have to make up friends to play with anymore? I'd have someone real?

0.speaker: Player
0.text: Of course he'll want you back - it's nature's will. You're meant to be together.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: You were very brave and resourceful. Think of how much you'll be able to help Thaniel.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Enough coddling. You're going back to Thaniel - now.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: People are dying for the sake of your fun, kid.

19.speaker: Halsin
19.context: NodeContext: Disapproving. We said something unnecessarily harsh to Oliver

26.speaker: Oliver
26.text: I told you already - nobody dies here. They come back, over and over, a little different every time.

45.speaker: Oliver
45.text: But I don't change, not really. So maybe I won't come back. Maybe the game will end with me.

6.speaker: Oliver
6.text: Maybe that's for the best. I'm tired. Nobody real wants to play me - they only want Thaniel. They can have him.

57.speaker: Oliver
57.text: Nobody dies here. They always come back to play with me, just a little different each time.

31.speaker: Player
31.text: Talk to him, Halsin. You know what needs to be said better than anyone.

46.speaker: Halsin
46.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin is addressing the playerNodeContext: Determined/stepping up to the plate (figuratively)

50.speaker: Halsin
50.text: Oliver. Nobody is making you leave - this is your home. But it is dark, empty... lonely. I don't want you to be alone. I want you to be with Thaniel.
50.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin is addressing OliverNodeContext: Gentle, empathetic. Like talking to a young, but smart, child (it's really an ageless spirit, but presents as a child)

38.speaker: Oliver
38.text: Why should I go back to him? He abandoned me!
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oliver is addressing HalsinNodeContext: Angry

61.speaker: Halsin
61.text: No - you were stolen from each other. Neither of you are to blame. And I know your pain. I truly do.
61.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin is addressing OliverNodeContext: Gentle, empathetic. Like talking to a young, but smart, child (it's really an ageless spirit, but presents as a child)

48.speaker: Halsin
48.text: Thaniel was my friend also. I played with him, grew up while he stayed the same. He made me who I am today, and then he was ripped away from me, same as for you.
48.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin is addressing OliverNodeContext: Gentle, empathetic. Like talking to a young, but smart, child (it's really an ageless spirit, but presents as a child)

16.speaker: Halsin
16.text: But you need not be alone any longer. You need not invent friends. Thaniel is back. He is waiting for you.
16.context: CinematicNodeContext: Halsin is addressing OliverNodeContext: Gentle, empathetic. Like talking to a young, but smart, child (it's really an ageless spirit, but presents as a child)

36.speaker: Oliver
36.text: ...Fine. I'll do it. It might be nice to be with him again.
36.context: CinematicNodeContext: Oliver is addressing HalsinNodeContext: Conceding

60.speaker: Oliver
60.text: Why couldn't you just leave me alone? Why can't I just stay here, playing? I had everything I've ever wanted, right here, and you've ruined it!
